examples: The disease destroys much of the inner ear, disturbing the animal's equilibrium.
Yoga is said to restore one's inner equilibrium.

definitions.definition: the state in which the reactants (= substances involved in a chemical reaction) and products (= substances produced in a chemical reaction) do not change because the rate of forward reaction (= when products are produced from reactants) is equal to the rate of reverse reaction (= when the original reactants return from the products)
